snippet: The secretary of state said the formation of a national unity government in Libya would prevent the Islamic State from seizing control of the country.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says that American-led coalition against Islamic State will intensify its military efforts to defeat group, but rules out sending American forces to intervene in Libya--where Sunni extremists are pressing to claim territory.

byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The secretary of state said the formation of a national unity government in Libya would prevent the Islamic State from seizing control of the country.

headline.main: Anti-ISIS Coalition to Intensify Efforts, John Kerry Says
headline.print_headline: Anti-ISIS Coalition Will Intensify Military Efforts, Kerry Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
